text: Got buy one get one free promo recently. Worth to buy mutton leg during this promo campaign. Taste also not bad.

Used to come here last time because it was nice and affordable, really disappointing to see how the shop has change.
Food is sweet even the lamb chop that cost $48 is also salty and sweet and overcooked. Strongly suggest the boss to change a chef.
When complaint to the staff, show no remorse, didn‚Äôt even apologize. Just change another portion but also not nice. Strongly not recommended. Will not patronize again.

Went there recently for supper. Was quite late when we went so place was fairly empty.

Ordered some meat skewers which was served fairly fast. Food was not bad, though some of them were a little too salty. The chicken satay was tender and flavourful, though it does not have as strong a chargrill taste.

Food is a little on the pricer side.

One of the best lamb shank bbq (charcoal grilled) that is operated by Chinese from mainland. The flavour is typically of XingJiang style as the dry rubs used are full of spices and chilli powder. The meat are tender and juicy but anticipated to be heaty if consumed just solely grilled meat hence we ordered their cold dishes. The cucumber salad is especially good and the bean curd ‚Äúnoodles‚Äù( I believe it‚Äôs by the expert hand cut of the chef). The most attractive offer here is the Chinese imported beers with lots of variety. We kept with the premium Tsingtao which is smoother and tastier. If unsure of what to order, just look around you and tell the waiter to mimic the neighboring table. Can‚Äôt go wrong here. Excellent place for drinking and the skewers are especially fitting when consumed with their cold beers. üëçüëç my verdict is a two thumbs up. Definitely coming back here again. Cheers
Food is reasonably priced. Parking by the road is available but quite packed. Paid parking is nearby. Came here many times. A nice quiet place for simple get together.
